hero_title: Rethinking access to money. For everyone. Everywhere.
hero_subtitle: Transfer Z enables young people to send and receive money locally and internationally â€” without a SIM card, without a bank account, using only a digital identity (DID) and a mobile phone.
problem_desc: Despite the growth of digital financial services, many young people and informal workers in West Africa remain excluded:
problem_1: Money transfers are restricted to the same phone number and name due to ECOWAS regulations.
problem_2: No way to receive money without a SIM card or national ID.
problem_3: Lack of interoperability between Mobile Money operators.
problem_4: Strong reliance on physical agents or trusted third parties.
solution_point_1: Create a digital identity (DID) that is independent of phone numbers.
solution_point_2: Enable money transfers locally and internationally without a SIM card.
solution_point_3: Use stablecoins to ensure value and support multi-currency conversion.
solution_point_4: Connect Mobile Money operators via blockchain.
solution_point_5: Provide access through a light mobile interface or certified agents.
